Spatial grid sampling methods

Source: R/ebirdst-sample.R
ebirdst_sample.Rd

Methods for subsampling data to deal with spatiotemporal bias in observations. These functions define a grid in space and time, then sample the given number of points from each cell. sample_case_control() additionally samples presence and absence independently.

sample_grid(x, res, t_res, n = 1, replace = FALSE, jitter = TRUE)

sample_case_control(x, res, t_res, n = 1, replace = FALSE,
  jitter = TRUE)

Arguments

x

data frame or sf point object; the points to subsample
res

numeric; the size in meters of the grid to sample from. This can be a 2 element vector indicating the x and y dimensions of the cells.
t_res

numeric; the temporal resolution for sampling expressed as a proportion of the year. For example, 7 / 375 would result in sampling from each week.
n

integer; the number of points to sample from each grid cell.
replace

logical; whether to sample with replacement.
jitter

logical; to avoid always using the same grid for sampling, the grid can be jittered so that the origin is different each time this function is called.

Value

Logical vector indicating which rows are selected.

Examples


# download example data
sp_path <- download_data("example_data")
#> Data already exists, use force = TRUE to re-download.

# test data to sample
test_data <- load_test_data(sp_path, return_sf = TRUE)

# sample on a 100km, 1 month grid
s <- sample_grid(test_data, res = 100000, t_res = 1 / 12)
td_grid <- test_data[s, ]

# plot
library(sf)
#> Linking to GEOS 3.6.1, GDAL 2.1.3, PROJ 4.9.3
p <- par(mar = c(0, 0, 0, 0))
plot(st_geometry(test_data), col = "black", pch = 19, cex = 0.2)
plot(st_geometry(td_grid), col = "red", pch = 19, cex = 0.5, add = TRUE)
par(p)

# case control sampling independently samples presence and absence
s <- sample_case_control(test_data, res = 100000, t_res = 1 / 12)
td_cc <- test_data[s, ]

# grid sampling preserves the presence/absence ratio
table(test_data$obs > 0) / nrow(test_data)
#> 
#>      FALSE       TRUE 
#> 0.97436928 0.02563072 
table(td_grid$obs > 0) / nrow(td_grid)
#> 
#>      FALSE       TRUE 
#> 0.95933014 0.04066986 
# while case control sampling increases the prevelance of presences
table(td_cc$obs > 0) / nrow(td_cc)
#> 
#>     FALSE      TRUE 
#> 0.7036329 0.2963671
